channel.title: process_creation on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in process_creation on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious WMI Execution Using Rundll32
item.description: Detects WMI executing rundll32

item.title: Suspicious AdFind Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of a AdFind for Active Directory enumeration

item.title: Snatch Ransomware
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Snatch ransomware word document droppers

item.title: DNSCat2 Powershell Implementation Detection Via Process Creation
item.description: The PowerShell implementation of DNSCat2 calls nslookup to craft queries. Counting nslookup processes spawned by PowerShell will show hundreds or thousands of instances if PS DNSCat2 is active locally.

item.title: Winnti Pipemon Characteristics
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Winnti Pipemon malware reported by ESET

item.title: Webshell Recon Detection Via CommandLine & Processes
item.description: Looking for processes spawned by web server components that indicate reconnaissance by popular public domain webshells for whether perl, python or wget are installed.

item.title: DNS RCE CVE-2020-1350
item.description: Detects exploitation of DNS RCE bug reported in CVE-2020-1350 by the detection of suspicious sub process

item.title: Regsvr32 Flags Anomaly
item.description: Detects a flag anomaly in which regsvr32.exe uses a /i flag without using a /n flag at the same time

item.title: EvilNum Golden Chickens Deployment via OCX Files
item.description: Detects Golden Chickens deployment method as used by Evilnum in report published in July 2020

item.title: Explorer Root Flag Process Tree Break
item.description: Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe /root, which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer

item.title: Disabled IE Security Features
item.description: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features

item.title: Ke3chang Registry Key Modifications
item.description: Detects Registry modifcations performaed by Ke3chang malware in campaigns running in 2019 and 2020

item.title: Cmd.exe CommandLine Path Traversal
item.description: detects the usage of path traversal in cmd.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

item.title: Advanced IP Scanner
item.description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: Maze Ransomware
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Maze ransomware word document droppers

item.title: Harvesting of Wifi Credentials Using netsh.exe
item.description: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe

item.title: PowerShell DownloadFile
item.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

item.title: Exploited CVE-2020-10189 Zoho ManageEngine
item.description: Detects the exploitation of Zoho ManageEngine Desktop Central Java Deserialization vulnerability reported as CVE-2020-10189

item.title: Process Dump via Rundll32 and Comsvcs.dll
item.description: Detects a process memory dump performed via ordinal function 24 in comsvcs.dll

item.title: Koadic Execution
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Koadic hack tool

item.title: Wsreset UAC Bypass
item.description: Detects a method that uses Wsreset.exe tool that can be used to reset the Windows Store to bypass UAC

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: FromBase64String Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious FromBase64String expressions in command line arguments

item.title: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64
item.description: Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation

item.title: ZOHO Dctask64 Process Injection
item.description: Detects suspicious process injection using ZOHO’s dctask64.exe

item.title: MSTSC Shadowing
item.description: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing

item.title: Tasks Folder Evasion
item.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

item.title: Windows Credential Editor
item.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

item.title: Copy from Admin Share
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command from a remote C$ or ADMIN$ share

item.title: SecurityXploded Tool
item.description: Detects the execution of SecurityXploded Tools

item.title: Suspect Svchost Activity
item.description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.

item.title: Trickbot Malware Recon Activity
item.description: Trickbot enumerates domain/network topology and executes certain commands automatically every few minutes. This detectors attempts to identify that activity based off a command rarely observed in an enterprise network.

item.title: CreateMiniDump Hacktool
item.description: Detects the use of CreateMiniDump hack tool used to dump the LSASS process memory for credential extraction on the attacker’s machine

item.title: Operation Wocao Activity
item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.title: Bloodhound and Sharphound Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

item.title: Ryuk Ransomware
item.description: Detects Ryuk ransomware activity

item.title: Exploiting CVE-2019-1388
item.description: Detects an explotation attempt in which the UAC consent dialogue is used to invoke an Internet Explorer process running as LOCAL_SYSTEM

item.title: Renamed ProcDump
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable often used by attackers or malware

item.title: Exploiting SetupComplete.cmd CVE-2019-1378
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt of privilege escalation vulnerability via SetupComplete.cmd and PartnerSetupComplete.cmd decribed in CVE-2019-1378

item.title: Suspicious MsiExec Directory
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts in an uncommon directory

item.title: Direct Autorun Keys Modification
item.description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.

item.title: Change Default File Association
item.description: When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

item.title: Mustang Panda Dropper
item.description: Detects specific process parameters as used by Mustang Panda droppers

item.title: DTRACK Process Creation
item.description: Detects specific process parameters as seen in DTRACK infections

item.title: Service Execution
item.description: Detects manual service execution (start) via system utilities

item.title: Audio Capture via PowerShell
item.description: Detects audio capture via PowerShell Cmdlet

item.title: Audio Capture via SoundRecorder
item.description: Detect attacker collecting audio via SoundRecorder application

item.title: Bypass UAC via CMSTP
item.description: Detect child processes of automatically elevated instances of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe).

item.title: Bypass UAC via Fodhelper.exe
item.description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

item.title: Bypass UAC via WSReset.exe
item.description: Identifies use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

item.title: HH.exe Execution
item.description: Identifies usage of hh.exe executing recently modified .chm files.

item.title: Indirect Command Execution
item.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcalua.exe or forfiles.exe

item.title: Interactive AT Job
item.description: Detect an interactive AT job, which may be used as a form of privilege escalation

item.title: LSASS Memory Dumping
item.description: Detect creation of dump files containing the memory space of lsass.exe, which contains sensitive credentials. Identifies usage of Sysinternals procdump.exe to export the memory space of lsass.exe which contains sensitive credentials.

item.title: Mshta JavaScript Execution
item.description: Identifies suspicious mshta.exe commands

item.title: Net.exe User Account Creation
item.description: Identifies creation of local users via the net.exe command

item.title: Suspicious Bitsadmin Job via PowerShell
item.description: Detect download by BITS jobs via PowerShell

item.title: Windows Network Enumeration
item.description: Identifies attempts to enumerate hosts in a network using the built-in Windows net.exe tool.

item.title: Query Registry
item.description: Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software.

item.title: Detection of Possible Rotten Potato
item.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with LOCAL SERVICE or NETWORK SERVICE privileges

item.title: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions
item.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.exe
item.description: Execute C# code located in the consoleapp folder

item.title: Possible App Whitelisting Bypass via WinDbg/CDB as a Shellcode Runner
item.description: Launch 64-bit shellcode from a debugger script file using cdb.exe.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Bginfo
item.description: Execute VBscript code that is referenced within the *.bgi file.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dxcap.exe
item.description: Detects execution of of Dxcap.exe

item.title: Malicious Payload Download via Office Binaries
item.description: Downloads payload from remote server

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via DLL Loaded by odbcconf.exe
item.description: Detects defence evasion attempt via odbcconf.exe execution to load DLL

item.title: Capture a Network Trace with netsh.exe
item.description: Detects capture a network trace via netsh.exe trace functionality

item.title: Suspicious Netsh DLL Persistence
item.description: Detects persitence via netsh helper

item.title: Suspicious Service Path Modification
item.description: Detects service path modification to powershell/cmd

item.title: Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution
item.description: Execution of well known tools for data exfiltration and tunneling

item.title: Tap Installer Execution
item.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunneling techniques

item.title: Non Interactive PowerShell
item.description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at powershell.exe with not explorer.exe as a parent.

item.title: Suspicious HWP Sub Processes
item.description: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation

item.title: SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution
item.description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use

item.title: Sysmon Driver Unload
item.description: Detect possible Sysmon driver unload

item.title: Devtoolslauncher.exe Executes Specified Binary
item.description: The Devtoolslauncher.exe executes other binary

item.title: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary
item.description: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary

item.title: Data Compressed - rar.exe
item.description: An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network

item.title: Suspicious Call by Ordinal
item.description: Detects suspicious calls of DLLs in rundll32.dll exports by ordinal

item.title: Psr.exe Capture Screenshots
item.description: The psr.exe captures desktop screenshots and saves them on the local machine

item.title: Suspicious Compression Tool Parameters
item.description: Detects suspicious command line arguments of common data compression tools

item.title: Suspicious Code Page Switch
item.description: Detects a code page switch in command line or batch scripts to a rare language

item.title: WMI Backdoor Exchange Transport Agent
item.description: Detects a WMi backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMi event filters

item.title: Formbook Process Creation
item.description: Detects Formbook like process executions that inject code into a set of files in the System32 folder, which executes a special command command line to delete the dropper from the AppData Temp folder. We avoid false positives by excluding all parent process with command line parameters.

item.title: Emotet Process Creation
item.description: Detects all Emotet like process executions that are not covered by the more generic rules

item.title: Control Panel Items
item.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

item.title: Suspicious Csc.exe Source File Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious execution of csc.exe, which uses a source in a suspicious folder (e.g. AppData)

item.title: Encoded FromBase64String
item.description: Detects a base64 encoded FromBase64String keyword in a process command line

item.title: Encoded IEX
item.description: Detects a base64 encoded IEX command string in a process command line

item.title: Renamed PowerShell
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed PowerShell often used by attackers or malware

item.title: Suspicious Double Extension
item.description: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns

item.title: Highly Relevant Renamed Binary
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

item.title: Renamed Binary
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

item.title: Windows 10 Scheduled Task SandboxEscaper 0-day
item.description: Detects Task Scheduler .job import arbitrary DACL write\par

item.title: Terminal Service Process Spawn
item.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)

item.title: Renamed PsExec
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed PsExec often used by attackers or malware

item.title: Empire PowerShell Launch Parameters
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell command line parameters used in Empire

item.title: Baby Shark Activity
item.description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware

item.title: Judgement Panda Credential Access Activity
item.description: Detects Russian group activity as described in Global Threat Report 2019 by Crowdstrike

item.title: Judgement Panda Exfil Activity
item.description: Detects Judgement Panda activity as described in Global Threat Report 2019 by Crowdstrike

item.title: Adwind RAT / JRAT
item.description: Detects javaw.exe in AppData folder as used by Adwind / JRAT

item.title: Cmdkey Cached Credentials Recon
item.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials

item.title: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
item.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: Detection of PowerShell Execution via DLL
item.description: Detects PowerShell Strings applied to rundll as seen in PowerShdll.dll

item.title: Dridex Process Pattern
item.description: Detects typical Dridex process patterns

item.title: Droppers Exploiting CVE-2017-11882
item.description: Detects exploits that use CVE-2017-11882 to start EQNEDT32.EXE and other sub processes like mshta.exe

item.title: Executables Started in Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects process starts of binaries from a suspicious folder

item.title: Execution in Non-Executable Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious exection from an uncommon folder

item.title: Execution in Webserver Root Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in a web service root folder (filter out false positives)

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2017-0261
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process FLTLDR.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2017-0261 and CVE-2017-0262

item.title: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe
item.description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

item.title: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation
item.description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line

item.title: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
item.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)

item.title: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines
item.description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines

item.title: MavInject Process Injection
item.description: Detects process injection using the signed Windows tool Mavinject32.exe

item.title: Microsoft Office Product Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a Windows command and scripting interpreter executable started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher and Visio

item.title: Microsoft Workflow Compiler
item.description: Detects invocation of Microsoft Workflow Compiler, which may permit the execution of arbitrary unsigned code.

item.title: MMC Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MMC

item.title: MSHTA Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MSHTA

item.title: MSHTA Spwaned by SVCHOST
item.description: Detects MSHTA.EXE spwaned by SVCHOST as seen in LethalHTA and described in report

item.title: MsiExec Web Install
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addreses as parameter

item.title: Net.exe Execution
item.description: Detects execution of Net.exe, whether suspicious or benign.

item.title: NotPetya Ransomware Activity
item.description: Detects NotPetya ransomware activity in which the extracted passwords are passed back to the main module via named pipe, the file system journal of drive C is deleted and windows eventlogs are cleared using wevtutil

item.title: Ping Hex IP
item.description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address

item.title: Possible Applocker Bypass
item.description: Detects execution of executables that can be used to bypass Applocker whitelisting

item.title: Possible Shim Database Persistence via sdbinst.exe
item.description: Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe. A shim can be used to load malicious DLLs into applications.

item.title: Powershell AMSI Bypass via .NET Reflection
item.description: Detects Request to amsiInitFailed that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning

item.title: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Shellcode
item.description: Detects Base64 encoded Shellcode

item.title: PowerShell Download from URL
item.description: Detects a Powershell process that contains download commands in its command line string

item.title: PowerShell Script Run in AppData
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder

item.title: PsExec Service Start
item.description: Detects a PsExec service start

item.title: Quick Execution of a Series of Suspicious Commands
item.description: Detects multiple suspicious process in a limited timeframe

item.title: Reconnaissance Activity with Net Command
item.description: Detects a set of commands often used in recon stages by different attack groups

item.title: Regsvr32 Anomaly
item.description: Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe

item.title: Rubeus Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Rubeus hack tool

item.title: Scheduled Task Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session

item.title: Shells Spawned by Web Servers
item.description: Web servers that spawn shell processes could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or an other attack

item.title: SquiblyTwo
item.description: Detects WMI SquiblyTwo Attack with possible renamed WMI by looking for imphash

item.title: Suspicious Certutil Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft certutil execution with sub commands like ‘decode’ sub command, which is sometimes used to decode malicious code with the built-in certutil utility

item.title: Suspicious Commandline Escape
item.description: Detects suspicious process that use escape characters

item.title: Suspicious Control Panel DLL Load
item.description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits

item.title: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation Based on Parent Process
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Parameter Substring
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring

item.title: Suspicious Process Start Locations
item.description: Detects suspicious process run from unusual locations

item.title: Suspicious RASdial Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe

item.title: Suspicious RDP Redirect Using TSCON
item.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe

item.title: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious command line activity on Windows systems

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on arguments

item.title: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access
item.description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL

item.title: Suspicious TSCON Start
item.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM

item.title: Suspicious Use of Procdump
item.description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we’re also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.

item.title: Suspicious WMI Execution
item.description: Detects WMI executing suspicious commands

item.title: Sysprep on AppData Folder
item.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)

item.title: System File Execution Location Anomaly
item.description: Detects a Windows program executable started in a suspicious folder

item.title: Taskmgr as Parent
item.description: Detects the creation of a process from Windows task manager

item.title: WannaCry Ransomware
item.description: Detects WannaCry ransomware activity

item.title: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords
item.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells

item.title: Whoami Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exloitation / privilege escalation but rarely used by administrators

item.title: Windows Shell Spawning Suspicious Program
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Windows shell

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI script event consumers

item.title: WScript or CScript Dropper
item.description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

item.title: WSF/JSE/JS/VBA/VBE File Execution
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript

item.title: Default PowerSploit and Empire Schtasks Persistence
item.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.

item.title: Chafer Activity
item.description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018

item.title: Taskmgr as LOCAL_SYSTEM
item.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM

item.title: Defrag Deactivation
item.description: Detects the deactivation of the Scheduled defragmentation task as seen by Slingshot APT group

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2015-1641
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process MicroScMgmt.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2015-1641

item.title: Elise Backdoor
item.description: Detects Elise backdoor acitivty as used by APT32

item.title: Equation Group DLL_U Load
item.description: Detects a specific tool and export used by EquationGroup

item.title: Hurricane Panda Activity
item.description: Detects Hurricane Panda Activity

item.title: Ps.exe Renamed SysInternals Tool
item.description: Detects renamed SysInternals tool execution with a binary named ps.exe as used by Dragonfly APT group and documented in TA17-293A report

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2017-8759
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process csc.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2017-8759

item.title: APT29
item.description: This method detects a suspicious powershell command line combination as used by APT29 in a campaign against US think tanks

item.title: ZxShell Malware
item.description: Detects a ZxShell start by the called and well-known function name

item.title: Bitsadmin Download
item.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file

item.title: BlueMashroom DLL Load
item.description: Detects a suspicious DLL loading from AppData Local path as described in BlueMashroom report

item.title: Certutil Encode
item.description: Detects suspicious a certutil command that used to encode files, which is sometimes used for data exfiltration

item.title: COMPlus_ETWEnabled Command Line Arguments
item.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

item.title: Covenant Launcher Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers

item.title: CrackMapExec Command Execution
item.description: Detect various execution methods of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

item.title: CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation
item.description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.

item.title: CrackMapExecWin
item.description: Detects CrackMapExecWin Activity as Described by NCSC

item.title: DIT Snapshot Viewer Use
item.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool. Seems to be a tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: DNS Tunnel Technique from MuddyWater
item.description: Detecting DNS tunnel activity for Muddywater actor

item.title: Emissary Panda Malware SLLauncher
item.description: Detects the execution of DLL side-loading malware used by threat group Emissary Panda aka APT27

item.title: Empire Monkey
item.description: Detects EmpireMonkey APT reported Activity

item.title: Empire PowerShell UAC Bypass
item.description: Detects some Empire PowerShell UAC bypass methods

item.title: Execution in Outlook Temp Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder

item.title: Execution of Renamed PaExec
item.description: Detects execution of renamed paexec via imphash and executable product string

item.title: Findstr Launching .lnk File
item.description: Detects usage of findstr to identify and execute a lnk file as seen within the HHS redirect attack

item.title: Fireball Archer Install
item.description: Detects Archer malware invocation via rundll32

item.title: Firewall Disabled via Netsh
item.description: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall

item.title: Fsutil Suspicious Invocation
item.description: Detects suspicious parameters of fsutil (deleting USN journal, configuring it with small size..). Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others)

item.title: GALLIUM Artefacts
item.description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.

item.title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators
item.description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020

item.title: HTML Help Shell Spawn
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help system when executing compiled HTML files (.chm)

item.title: Impacket Lateralization Detection
item.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

item.title: Lazarus Session Highjacker
item.description: Detects executables launched outside their default directories as used by Lazarus Group (Bluenoroff)

item.title: Mimikatz Command Line
item.description: Detection well-known mimikatz command line arguments

item.title: MS Office Product Spawning Exe in User Dir
item.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher or Visio

item.title: Netsh Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding

item.title: Netsh Port or Application Allowed
item.description: Allow Incoming Connections by Port or Application on Windows Firewall

item.title: Netsh Program Allowed with Suspcious Location
item.description: Detects Netsh commands that allows a suspcious application location on Windows Firewall

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding of port 3389 used for RDP

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Opening
item.description: Detects netsh commands that opens the port 3389 used for RDP, used in Sarwent Malware

item.title: Possible Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Modifications
item.description: Detects, possibly, malicious unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

item.title: Possible SPN Enumeration
item.description: Detects Service Principal Name Enumeration used for Kerberoasting

item.title: PowerShell Encoded Character Syntax
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

item.title: Process Dump via Comsvcs DLL
item.description: Detects process memory dump via comsvcs.dll and rundll32

item.title: QBot Process Creation
item.description: Detects QBot like process executions

item.title: Rar with Password or Compression Level
item.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: Renamed jusched.exe
item.description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group

item.title: Renamed SysInternals Debug View
item.description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from ADS
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)

item.title: Run Whoami as SYSTEM
item.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed by LOCAL SYSTEM. This may be a sign of a successful local privilege escalation.

item.title: Shadow Copies Access via Symlink
item.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

item.title: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

item.title: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities

item.title: Sofacy Trojan Loader Activity
item.description: Detects Trojan loader acitivty as used by APT28

item.title: Squirrel Lolbin
item.description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin

item.title: Suspicious Calculator Usage
item.description: Detects suspicious use of calc.exe with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion

item.title: Suspicious Copy From or To System32
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command that copies a system program from System32 to another directory on disk - sometimes used to use LOLBINs like certutil or desktopimgdownldr to a different location with a different name

item.title: Suspicious Curl File Upload
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

item.title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

item.title: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
item.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious Eventlog Clear or Configuration Using Wevtutil
item.description: Detects clearing or configuration of eventlogs uwing wevtutil, powershell and wmic. Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others)

item.title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook
item.description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook

item.title: Suspicious GUP Usage
item.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks

item.title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe
item.description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious Program Location Process Starts
item.description: Detects programs running in suspicious files system locations

item.title: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
item.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

item.title: TAIDOOR RAT DLL Load
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Chinese TAIDOOR RAT malware load

item.title: TropicTrooper Campaign November 2018
item.description: Detects TropicTrooper activity, an actor who targeted high-profile organizations in the energy and food and beverage sectors in Asia

item.title: Turla Group Commands May 2020
item.description: Detects commands used by Turla group as reported by ESET in May 2020

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group

item.title: Unidentified Attacker November 2018
item.description: A sigma rule detecting an unidetefied attacker who used phishing emails to target high profile orgs on November 2018. The Actor shares some TTPs with YYTRIUM/APT29 campaign in 2016.

item.title: Windows Kernel and 3rd-Party Drivers Exploits Token Stealing
item.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with non-SYSTEM privileges and Medium integrity level

item.title: Winnti Malware HK University Campaign
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Winnti malware noticed in Dec/Jan 2020 in a campaign against Honk Kong universities

item.title: WMI Spawning Windows PowerShell
item.description: Detects WMI spawning PowerShell

item.title: WMIExec VBS Script
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript
